questions.paragraph: Wood is not used in making electrical wires. Explain.
popup: Because it is difficult to be shaped into wires, and it has poor electrical conductivity.

questions.paragraph: (Jana) wanted to make a box for her tools to see them easily, so she used glass because it has a specific physical property. Identify the property.
How can you differentiate between two bottles, one of which contains water, and the other contains perfume?
popup: By the difference in their odor.

questions.paragraph: What happens if copper was a bad conductor of electricity?
popup: We would not be able to use it in making electrical wires.

questions.paragraph: Helium is preferred for use in balloons over air due to its specific properties. List these properties.
When placing a piece of wood and an iron nail in water, which of them will float and which of them will sink?
popup: The piece of wood will float, while the iron nail will sink .
